definition: see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: Economic construction is an overriding task of China.
sentences.chinese: 经济建设是中国压倒一切的中心任务。

sentences.english: The name of the eclipsing girl, whatever it was, has not been handed down.
sentences.chinese: 压倒群芳的少女，姓名并未留传下来。

sentences.english: Some larches are bent down by the weight of the snow.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些落叶松被厚重的积雪压倒了。

sentences.english: This is a devastating and, I think, brilliant argument.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这是压倒性的，极其精彩的论证。

sentences.english: Megan’s fast reaction got her to go grab Mrs. McKinley’s leg and pin it to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 梅金反应很快，她抓住麦丽金的腿，把她压倒在地。

sentences.english: The overwhelming majority of the internet voter support the new holliday policy.
sentences.chinese: 压倒多数的网民投票支持新的假日政策。

sentences.english: Loyalist forces using tanks and rockets outgunned the rebel groups.
sentences.chinese: 扎卡菲拥护者使用坦克和火箭重火力压倒了反对者。

sentences.english: Facts should constitute the overriding principle and nothing can interfere with this.
sentences.chinese: 事实压倒一切的原则不应受到任何东西的干扰。

sentences.english: Their overwhelming numbers could destroy us.
sentences.chinese: 单凭他们那庞大的压倒性的人数就可以之我们于死地。

sentences.english: The security fuard launched himself and took him down to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 这位保全向那个抢匪猛扑过去，把他压倒在地上。

sentences.english: He was elected governor in 2006 by a landslide.
sentences.chinese: 2006年，他以压倒优势当选纽约州州长。

sentences.english: She's yelling to beat the band.
sentences.chinese: 她大声叫喊，压倒了管乐队。

sentences.english: The act was adopted by an overwhelming majority.
sentences.chinese: 该法案以压倒多数通过。

sentences.english: The company was drowned in bad debts.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司被坏账所压倒。

sentences.english: Internet users have voted overwhelmingly in favor of new holidays.
sentences.chinese: 压倒多数的网民投票支持新的假日政策。

definition: to cause sth to collapse under the weight/(fig.) to overwhelm
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
to crush or compact by means of a roller
on the up/currently winning/rising (in popularity etc)
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
